page.title: 12Farming in Chilsworty
page.content: One farm in our area keeps{90 head {of cattle}for{beef and dairy products. This is the maximum amount they can keep on their{66 acres of land.}To supplement their grazing the animals are fed{cattle cake}mornings and evenings. Each year{silage and hay is {harvested for winter feeding.}The farmer rises each day at 7.15 and his daily work continues till 10.00 each night.Visits to market in and around neighbouring towns are as frequent as necessary as the farm{breeds most of {its own stock}often borrowing a bull from other farmers in the district. This farm also keeps two pigs for special occasions. The farmer thought that farming had become less labour- intensive over the years with increasing mechanisation but was not in favour of factory farming as such.
